multipathaic 0.1.0

Confusion Matrix and Diagnostic Metrics for Selected Logistic Models

Source: R/multipathaic.R
confusion_metrics.Rd

Computes a confusion matrix and several standard diagnostic metrics for a **logistic regression model** selected by the Multi-Path AIC procedure.

This function extracts a model from the set of plausible models produced by [`multipath_aic()`], refits the logistic regression on the original data, and evaluates its predictive performance at a user-specified cutoff.

confusion_metrics(result_object, model_index = 1, cutoff = 0.5, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

result_object

The full output list returned by [`multipath_aic()`]. Must contain `forest` and `plaus`.

model_index

Integer index specifying which plausible model to evaluate. Default is `1` (the top plausible model).

cutoff

Probability threshold for classification. Default: `0.5`.

verbose

Logical; if TRUE, prints the confusion matrix and metrics.

Value

A data frame containing:

Prevalence

Proportion of true positives.

Accuracy

Correct classification rate.

Sensitivity

True positive rate.

Specificity

True negative rate.

FDR

False discovery rate.

DOR

Diagnostic odds ratio.

Details

The metrics computed include:

  • Prevalence — proportion of positive outcomes.

  • Accuracy — proportion of correct classifications.

  • Sensitivity (Recall) — \(TP / (TP + FN)\).

  • Specificity — \(TN / (TN + FP)\).

  • False Discovery Rate (FDR) — \(FP / (TP + FP)\).

  • Diagnostic Odds Ratio (DOR) — \((TP/FN) / (FP/TN)\).

Examples

## Logistic Model Evaluation Example
set.seed(1)
n <- 150; p <- 6
X <- as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(n*p), n, p))
names(X) <- paste0("x", 1:p)
eta <- 1.5*X$x1 - 2*X$x2 + 1*X$x5
prob <- 1 / (1 + exp(-eta))
y <- rbinom(n, 1, prob)

result <- multipath_aic(
  X, y,
  family = "binomial",
  K = 6,
  B = 20,
  verbose = FALSE
)

# Evaluate first plausible model
confusion_metrics(result, model_index = 1)
#> 
#> ========== Confusion Metrics for Model ID 8 ==========
#> Variables: x1, x2, x3, x4, x5, x6 
#> 
#> Confusion Matrix (cutoff = 0.5 ):
#>          Actual
#> Predicted  1  0
#>         1 58 14
#>         0 14 64
#> 
#> Metrics:
#>   Prevalence Accuracy Sensitivity Specificity   FDR    DOR
#> 1       0.48    0.813       0.806       0.821 0.194 18.939
